definition: full of youthful vigor (idiom)/in the prime of youth
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
to hold/to contain/to ladle/to pick up with a utensil

sentences.english: The experience of our side and the youthful determination of the other balance each other out.
sentences.chinese: 我方经验丰富，对方年轻气盛决心大，两者不相上下。

sentences.english: I don't blame the young guys for trying to make a splash.
sentences.chinese: 我不指责那些年轻气盛想要引起轰动的人。

definition: full of sap (idiom); young and vigorous
competitive/ambitious and aggressive/to desire to beat others
to let emotions affect one's decisions
lit. newborn calves do not fear tigers (idiom)/fig. the young are fearless
pinyin: chu1 sheng1 niu2 du2 bu4 pa4 hu3

definition: venturing from one's thatched hut for the first time (idiom)/young and inexperienced/novice/greenhorn
not to know the immensity of heaven and earth/an exaggerated opinion of one's own abilities
pinyin: bu4 zhi1 tian1 gao1 di4 hou4

definition: to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
